intro: Schismatoglottis petradoxa, commonly known as the Paredes' schismatoglottis, is a species of flowering plant in the family Cyclanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Ecuador and Peru. The plant is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and large, heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, typically arranged in clusters at the base of the plant. Schismatoglottis petradoxa is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
